description: Verify that the test plan details page loads correctly with proper authentication
scenario: Admin user navigates to a specific test plan's details page to view comprehensive test information
expected_results: Display the test plan details page with header, test information, procedure, status, and properties
procedure:
1. Log in as admin user
2. Navigate to /admin/system-test/test-plans/{test_plan_id}
3. Verify page loads completely
4. Check header with 'Test Plan Details' title
5. Verify test plan number and module name in subtitle

description: Verify that non-admin users cannot access the test plan details page
scenario: Regular user attempts to access test plan viewing functionality
expected_results: Access should be denied with 403 Forbidden error
procedure:
1. Log in as regular user (non-admin)
2. Attempt to navigate to /admin/system-test/test-plans/1
3. Verify 403 Forbidden error is returned
4. Check redirect to appropriate error page
5. Ensure no test plan data is accessible

screen_design_ref: Figure 27.3: Test Plan Not Found Handling
description: Verify proper handling when test plan ID does not exist
scenario: Admin attempts to view a test plan that doesn't exist in the database
expected_results: Display 404 Not Found error page
procedure:
1. Log in as admin user
2. Navigate to /admin/system-test/test-plans/99999 (non-existent ID)
3. Verify 404 error is returned
4. Check appropriate error page is displayed
5. Confirm no sensitive information is exposed

description: Verify the page header contains proper title, subtitle, and navigation buttons
scenario: Admin reviews page header for clear navigation and context
expected_results: Display header with title, test plan info, and action buttons (Back, Edit, Execute)
procedure:
1. Navigate to test plan details page
2. Check title 'Test Plan Details' is displayed prominently
3. Verify subtitle shows test plan number and module name
4. Confirm 'Back to List' button navigates to test plans list
5. Check 'Edit' and 'Execute Test' buttons are present and functional

description: Verify the test information section displays all test plan details correctly

expected_results: Display test information section with test plan number, module, description, scenario, and expected results
procedure:
1. Locate 'Test Information' section with blue border and info icon
2. Verify test plan number and module are displayed in grid layout
3. Check screen design reference shows when available
4. Confirm description is displayed clearly
5. Verify scenario shows when provided
6. Check expected results are properly displayed

description: Verify that screen design reference is shown only when available
scenario: Admin views test plans with and without screen design references
expected_results: Screen design reference section appears only when data exists
procedure:
1. View test plan with screen_design_ref data
2. Verify screen design reference section is displayed
3. View test plan without screen_design_ref
4. Confirm screen design reference section is hidden
5. Check conditional display works correctly

description: Verify that scenario is shown only when available
scenario: Admin views test plans with and without scenario descriptions
expected_results: Scenario section appears only when data exists
procedure:
1. View test plan with scenario data
2. Verify scenario section is displayed
3. View test plan without scenario
4. Confirm scenario section is hidden
5. Check conditional display works correctly

description: Verify the test procedure section displays steps in numbered format
scenario: Admin reviews test procedure to understand execution steps
expected_results: Display test procedure section with numbered steps and proper formatting
procedure:
1. Locate 'Test Procedure' section with green border and list icon
2. Verify procedure steps are split by newlines
3. Check each step is numbered automatically
4. Confirm steps are displayed in gray background boxes
5. Verify green border accent on each step box

description: Verify that empty lines in procedures are properly filtered out
scenario: Admin views test plan with procedure containing empty lines or whitespace
expected_results: Only non-empty procedure steps are displayed with proper numbering
procedure:
1. Create test plan with procedure containing empty lines
2. View test plan details page
3. Verify empty lines are filtered out using strip()
4. Check numbering remains sequential
5. Confirm clean display without empty step boxes

description: Verify the test status section displays current execution status correctly
scenario: Admin reviews test status to understand current execution state
expected_results: Display test status section with current status badge and execution information
procedure:
1. Locate 'Test Status' section in sidebar
2. Verify current status shows with appropriate badge color
3. Check status options: passed (green), failed (red), pending (yellow), skipped (gray)
4. Confirm badge text matches status value
5. Verify proper badge styling and icons

description: Verify that execution information is displayed when available
scenario: Admin views executed test plan to see execution history and details
expected_results: Display execution date and executed by information when test has been executed
procedure:
1. View test plan that has been executed
2. Verify 'Last Executed' shows formatted date (Month DD, YYYY at HH:MM AM/PM)
3. Check 'Executed By' shows username when available
4. View non-executed test plan
5. Confirm execution information is hidden when not available

description: Verify that failure reason is displayed correctly for failed tests
scenario: Admin views failed test plan to understand failure details
expected_results: Display failure reason in red-bordered box when test has failed
procedure:
1. View test plan with status 'failed' and failure_reason
2. Verify failure reason section appears
3. Check red background and border styling (bg-red-50, border-red-200)
4. Confirm failure reason text is displayed in red
5. View non-failed test plan and verify section is hidden

description: Verify the properties section displays priority, category, and timestamps correctly

expected_results: Display properties section with priority badge, category badge, and timestamp information
procedure:
1. Locate 'Properties' section in sidebar
2. Verify priority badge with correct color coding
3. Check category badge with purple styling
4. Confirm created date when available
5. Verify last updated date when available

description: Verify that priority badges display with correct colors for all priority levels
scenario: Admin reviews priority badges to understand test criticality through visual indicators
expected_results: Priority badges use correct colors: red (critical), orange (high), blue (medium), green (low)

2. Verify 'critical' priority shows red badge (bg-red-100)
3. Check 'high' priority shows orange badge (bg-orange-100)
4. Confirm 'medium' priority shows blue badge (bg-blue-100)
5. Verify 'low' priority shows green badge (bg-green-100)

description: Verify that category badge displays consistently with purple styling

expected_results: Category badge uses consistent purple styling with proper text formatting

2. Verify category badge uses purple background (bg-purple-100)
3. Check category text is properly title-cased
4. Confirm consistent styling across all category types
5. Verify purple text color (text-purple-800)

description: Verify the quick actions section provides easy access to test plan operations

procedure:

2. Verify 'Execute Test' button with green styling and play icon
3. Check 'Edit Test Plan' button with blue styling and pencil icon
4. Confirm 'Delete Test Plan' button with red styling and trash icon
5. Verify all buttons are full-width with proper icons

description: Verify that quick action buttons navigate to correct destinations

expected_results: Quick action buttons navigate to appropriate pages with correct test plan context
procedure:

2. Click 'Edit Test Plan' button and verify navigation to edit form
3. Test 'Delete Test Plan' button and verify confirmation dialog
4. Confirm all links pass correct test_plan_id parameter
5. Verify proper URL routing for all actions

description: Verify that delete confirmation works correctly with proper user confirmation

1. Click 'Delete Test Plan' button
2. Verify JavaScript confirmation dialog appears
3. Click 'Cancel' and confirm no deletion occurs
4. Click 'Delete Test Plan' again and confirm deletion
5. Verify deleteTestPlan function submits form with correct action URL
